label: Description
value: Fragment of cotton, close tabby weave, bright red background, design in yellow, printed (roller or plate?), drop repeat. Design of symmetrical arrangement, late classic influence. Shows confronted swans with pearls in beaks; below and above, palmette, foliage, rosettes, etc. Fragment shows two repeats scross, third interrupted. Right selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller or engraved copper plate on close tabby weave

label: Description
value: Coral-red satin ground with very large scale floral serpentine pattern in cream and pale green twill.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 156.5 x 54.5 cm (5 ft. 1 5/8 in. x 21 7/16 in.) Repeat H: 137.2 cm (54 in.)

label: Description
value: Design shows diamond shaped frame with pseudo-Egyptian hieroglyphics and figures in medallions. Three pseudo-Egyptian animal gods appear within the diamond shapes. The colors – yellow, tan, brown, deep pink, and red – are overprinted on pink, light-blue, deeper blue, green, and gray.  Hieroglyphics and frame are printed in black over a yellow background. In one medallion, kneeling female figure before animal-headed statue is against blue ground, very unevenly applied – possibly by hand. Green is made by printing blue over yellow.  Left selvage present and shows three blue threads.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 42 x 92 cm (16 9/16 x 36 1/4 in.) Repeat H: 27.9 cm (11 in.) Other (diamond frame) L: 21cm (8 1/4in.)

label: Notes
value: Design shows diamond shaped frame with pseudo-Egyptian hieroglyphics and figures in medallions. Three pseudo-Egyptian animal gods appear within the diamond shapes. The colors – yellow, tan, brown, deep pink, and red – are overprinted on pink, light-blue, deeper blue, green, and gray. Hieroglyphics and frame are printed in black over a yellow background. In one medallion, kneeling female figure before animal-headed statue is against blue ground, very unevenly applied – possibly by hand. Green is made by printing blue over yellow. value: Length of woven silk satin in bright green with repeating symmetrical sheild-shaped ornament in pale yellow down the center.

value: Medium: silk Technique: satin patterned by continuous supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Yellow-green damask with a large-scale symmetrical abstract pomegranate shape enclosing a single fleur-de-lys. Height of repeat was probably about 24 inches.

label: Dimensions
value: a) Warp x Weft: 114 x 61 cm (44 7/8 x 24 in.) b) Warp x Weft: 119 x 65 cm (46 7/8 x 25 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: A frame with inner corners chamfered in curves and decorated with scroll-work and panels showing stylized leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henriette B. Bonaventure

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangular panel with applied border on four sides. The panel consists of quatrefoil medallions alternately enclosing urns and musical symbols. Between medallions are stylized bellflowers radiating around a core. Red, orange, black and white on a light blue ground. Border pattern is Grecian honeysuckle in white on brown ground with red-orange, white, and blue butterflies. Printed on sheet paper in three lengths with wide margin in center of panel.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on handmade paper, fabric lining

label: Description
value: Tooled and engraved, contained in small box printed with C. E. Gifford and Co., Fall River, Mass. In script, on scrap of paper: Grandmother Gifford's sleeve-buttons.

label: Provenance
value: Donor states buttons worn by his great grandmother.

label: Description
value: Each caddy (a,b and c,d) formed of upright, rectangular body with repousse decoration of tea-picking chinoiserie figures in scrolled cartouche, with lion's head above and shell below, on front and back.  On sides, scene of building and foliage in scrolled cartouche. Each caddy with sliding cover, relief-cast, with flower knob.

label: Provenance
value: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Game-counter box, rectangular, with red- and green-stained hinged cover showing female figure representing Asia, with censer and turban, seated on a camel-drawn chariot, with attendant in backgound. Inside, game counters. One of a set of four boxes (1960-1-13-1a/v / 4a/v).

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Game-counter box, rectangular, with hinged cover showing crowned female figure representing Europe, holding sceptre and orb, seated on a horse-drawn chariot. Inside, game counters. One of a set of four boxes (1960-1-13-1a/v / 4a/v).

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Game-counter box, rectangular, with yellow- and green-stained hinged cover showing female figure representing Africa, holding parasol and tambourine, seated on a lion-drawn chariot. Inside, game counters. One of a set of four boxes (1960-1-13-1a/v / 4a/v).

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Asia" shows a seated man in a turban and loose robe. Behind him is blue fringed tent panel and two camels. He carries a scepter and a sword rests near his feet. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Europe" shows a seated female figure, crowned and holding a scepter. Behind her is a panel of red drapery and a rearing horse. Grapes and other fruits are by her feet. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white.  Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Africa" shows a draped female figure with a striped hat and spear. Bow and quiver rests near her legs. Just beyond her is an elephant, and in the far background are tent-like structures and palm trees. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "America" shows a seated indigenous male figure in a feathered headdress and skirt. He wears a heavy necklace and armbands on his upper arms. A parrot is perched on his right hand, and the left hand holds an arrow. Just beyond him lies a puma. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk Technique: tapestry weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: a) Bowl with engraved strapwork and four-lobed medallions. Shaped relief-cast handles, also with medallions. B) Domed cover, with strapwork-engraved gadrooned sides and small medallions; on top, medallion with Africa, surrounded by engraving; three scrolled feet.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value:
Helmet-shaped ewer on domed foot, engraved with strapwork, and bearing lobed medallions in two sizes, the larger representing Asia and America, the smaller Geometry, Music, etc.  Double-scrolled handle.
The basin is marli alternately lobed and straight, with guilloche band, strapwork engraving, and four large relief medallions representing the Four Elements, and four smaller medallions of the Four Continents.  Gadrooned well; raised center with relief medallion of Hercules crowned by Victory, framed in guilloche border and strapwork.

label: Dimensions
value: a) H: 27 x L: 23.3 x W: 11.2 cm b) H: 6 x  Di: 52.6 cm

label: Credit line

Charger with Alexander the Great Defeating Darius Surrounded by the Four Continents

label: Description
value: Oval, with four repoussé martial trophies on marli, wreath around center. Applied, on marli, four high relief medallions with the Four Continents (after Stefano della Bella's playing cards, published in Paris in 1646).  Asia, turbaned, in chariot drawn by two elephants; Europe, crowned, drawn by horses; Africa, with feather headdress and parasol, drawn by lions; America, in feather headdress and tunic, drawn by armadillos.  In center, relief plaque of Alexander and King Darius, lying dead in battle chariot with attending warriors (after an etching of 1645 by Hans Ulrich Frank).

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Oval, with four repoussé martial trophies on marli, wreath around center. Applied, on marli, four high relief medallions with the Four Continents (after Stefano della Bella's playing cards, published in Paris in 1646). Asia, turbaned, in chariot drawn by two elephants; Europe, crowned, drawn by horses; Africa, with feather headdress and parasol, drawn by lions; America, in feather headdress and tunic, drawn by armadillos. In center, relief plaque of Alexander and King Darius, lying dead in battle chariot with attending warriors (after an etching of 1645 by Hans Ulrich Frank).

Tea Urn in the Shape of Atlas Supporting the World

label: Description
value: In the form of Atlas supporting the world. Triangular base with openwork decoration, on three ball feet, supports kneeling figure of Atlas holding a spherical urn on his shoulders. Surface of urn with relief decoration featuring four wreathed circular medalions, each suspended from a bow and showing one of four allegorical figures of the continents (Europe, Asia, America, and Africa) with attributes. Two pendant tassels (one concealing a spout) below embossed acanthus leaves supporing two ring handles. Slightly domed cover with moveable laurel-shaped knop in center.

label: Provenance
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Tapering cup covered with the figures of the Four Continents; Asia with turban and crescent sceptre; Africa with ostrich-feather headdress and parasol; Europe with imperial crown, orb, and sceptre; America with feather headdress and cape, and sceptre; step with two putti; foot with elephant and rhinoceros interlocked in battle, and eagle. Domed cover with six putti in relief and one, standing, as finial.

label: Description
value:
Four figures (a, b, c, d)  together form a set.
(a): Standing female figure, wearing jeweled mantle and turban with half-moon, holding sceptre and censer. Relief cartouche with camel; (b): Standing female figure, wearing ermine and crown, holding sceptre and orb. Book, globe, cornice fragment, cornucopia and relief cartouche with horse; (c): Standing black female figure, wearing feather skirt, mantle, and elephant-head coif, holding sheaf of wheat. Relief cartouche with lion; (d): Standing female figure, wearing feather skirt, mantle, and headdress. Parrot perched on arm, quiver with arrows and relief cartouche with alligator.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

value: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum
